snippet: Early voting in Ohio for all residents was restored on Friday by the Sixth Circuit Court of Appeals, giving President Obama's campaign another victory in its legal battles with Republicans over voting issues.
abstract: Early voting in Ohio for all residents was restored on Friday by the Sixth Circuit Court of Appeals, giving President Obama's campaign another victory in its legal battles with Republicans over voting issues.

headline.main: Early Voting Is Restored in Ohio
headline.print_headline: Wider Early Voting Restored in Ohio, a Win for Obama’s Campaign
